FuncDef:
The sender-enable command configures a provider edge (PE) as a sender PE.
The undo sender-enable command restores the default configuration.
By default, a PE is a receiver PE.
ParentView: VPN instance IPv6 address family MVPN view
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
On an IPv6 next-generation multicast virtual private network (NG MVPN), a PE can be either a sender or receiver PE. Multicast data enters a point-to-multipoint (P2MP) tunnel from a sender PE and leaves the tunnel from a receiver PE. To configure a PE as a sender PE, run the sender-enable command. The PE connecting to the multicast source generally functions as a sender PE.
Configuration Impact
After a PE is configured as a sender PE, the PE has both the sender PE and receiver PE functionalities, meaning that the PE can send and receive multicast data through a P2MP tunnel.
